summary: Greenland is a large island in the Arctic, belonging to Denmark. It has its own government but is still connected to Denmark and the European Union. The capital is Nuuk. People have lived there for thousands of years, and it has been ruled by Norway and Denmark in the past. Most residents are Inuit, and the population is small, making it the least densely populated place on Earth. Greenland is known for its ice sheet and renewable energy sources.
title: Greenland
